com.oracle.tools.runtime.java
Class AbstractJavaApplication<A extends JavaApplication<A>>

java.lang.Object
  com.oracle.tools.runtime.AbstractApplication<A>
      com.oracle.tools.runtime.java.AbstractJavaApplication<A>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Application<A>, JavaApplication<A>
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpleJavaApplication
public abstract class AbstractJavaApplication<A extends JavaApplication<A>>
extends AbstractApplication<A>
implements JavaApplication<A>

A AbstractJavaApplication is a base implementation of a JavaApplication that has a Console (with standard output, standard error and standard input streams).

Copyright (c) 2011. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

Author:
Brian Oliver

Constructor Detail

AbstractJavaApplication

public AbstractJavaApplication(Process process,
                               String name,
                               ApplicationConsole console,
                               Properties environmentVariables,
                               Properties systemProperties,
                               long defaultTimeout,
                               TimeUnit defaultTimeoutUnits,
                               Iterable<LifecycleEventInterceptor<A>> interceptors)
Construct a AbstractJavaApplication.

Parameters:
process - the Process representing the JavaApplication
name - the name of the JavaApplication
console - the ApplicationConsole that will be used for I/O by the realized Application. This may be null if not required
environmentVariables - the environment variables used when starting the JavaApplication
systemProperties - the system properties provided to the JavaApplication
defaultTimeout - the default timeout duration
defaultTimeoutUnits - the default timeout duration TimeUnit
interceptors - the LifecycleEventInterceptors
Method Detail

getSystemProperties

public Properties getSystemProperties()
Obtains the system Properties that were supplied to the JavaApplication when it was realized.

Specified by:
getSystemProperties in interface JavaApplication<A extends JavaApplication<A>>
Returns:
a Properties of name value pairs, each one representing a system property provided to the JavaApplication as -Dname=value parameters when it was realized

Returns:

getMBeanProxy

public <T> T getMBeanProxy(ObjectName objectName,
                           Class<T> proxyClass)
Obtains a local proxy of an MBean registered with the JMX infrastructure in the JavaApplication.

If the JMX infrastructure in the JavaApplication is not yet available, it will block and wait for the default application timeout until it becomes available.

Specified by:
getMBeanProxy in interface JavaApplication<A extends JavaApplication<A>>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the MBean
Parameters:
objectName - the name of the MBean
proxyClass - the class of the proxy to create
Returns:
a proxy of type T

queryMBeans

public Set<ObjectInstance> queryMBeans(ObjectName name,
                                       QueryExp query)
Obtains a the result of an MBeans Query against the JMX infrastructure of the JavaApplication.

Specified by:
queryMBeans in interface JavaApplication<A extends JavaApplication<A>>
Parameters:
name - the object name pattern identifying the MBeans to be retrieved. If null or no domain and key properties are specified, all the MBeans registered will be retrieved
query - the query expression to be applied for selecting MBeans If null no query expression will be applied for selecting MBeans
Returns:
a Set of ObjectInstances

destroy

public int destroy()
Terminates and destroys the running Application. Upon returning from this method you can safely assume the Application is no longer running.

Specified by:
destroy in interface Application<A extends JavaApplication<A>>
Overrides:
destroy in class AbstractApplication<A extends JavaApplication<A>>
Returns:
the exit value of the Application (by convention 0 indicates normal termination)
